newsitem.title: CHINA: China crematorium to unveil new furnace for Deng.
newsitem.headline: China crematorium to unveil new furnace for Deng.

text.p: China's top crematorium will use a brand-new, specially-purchased incinerator to cremate paramount leader Deng Xiaoping to try to avoid his ashes being mixed with those of lesser men, Chinese sources said on Thursday.

The Babaoshan crematorium in western Beijing, where almost all Chinese leaders are reduced to ashes after they "go to meet Marx", had arranged in advance to import and install a new furnace for Deng, who died late on Wednesday night, they said.
Officials at the crematorium had been afraid that, if an existing incinerator were used, some of Deng's ashes could be mixed with those of other clients, the sources said.
A Babaoshan official contacted by telephone said he was unaware of new incinerator purchases and that the crematorium had yet to receive any directions on handling Deng's remains.
"The funerals of Chinese leaders are generally held in Babaoshan, but... we are not clear at the moment if Deng Xiaoping's funeral will be held here," he said but gave no details.
Beijing has long tried to protect precious farmland by curbing the traditional practice of burial for the dead and by encouraging cremation instead, a policy promoted by Deng.

The late Chairman Mao Zedong received neither treatment. His corpse was preserved after his death in 1976 and is displayed in a mausoleum built to his memory in central Beijing's vast Tiananmen Square.
